{"step_by_step_thinking": "Primary bone healing occurs when the fracture ends are anatomically reduced and rigidly fixed, allowing healing to occur without the formation of a callus. This type of healing is also known as direct healing. There are two types of direct healing: contact healing and gap healing. In gap healing, a small gap of up to 800 micrometers (0.8 mm) is filled with woven bone, which is then remodeled into lamellar bone.", "answer_choice": "B"}
